title: Countdown Timer for Shiny
text: shinyTimer allows easily integrate countdown timer Shiny UI, providing real-time updates server notification timer completes. examples make use shinyMobile framework.

title: Countdown Timer for Shiny
text: get things work need two functions: UI side shinyTimer() add widget. server side countDown() trigger counting. shinyTimer() default formatted simple one, can switch format clock.  can either set seconds, minutes .

title: Countdown Timer for Shiny
text: timer reaches 0 JavaScript sends timer_done value Shiny input. can use trigger action (see example ).
code: ui <- shinyMobile::f7Page(   shinyMobile::f7Card(     shinyTimer(       inputId = "shiny_timer",       seconds = 10L,        format = "simple",        style = "font-weight: bold; font-size: 72px; text-align:center"     ),     shinyMobile::f7Button(       "start_timer",       label = "Start",        size = "large",       rounded = TRUE,       color = "orange"     ) |>       htmltools::tagAppendAttributes(         style="font-size:20px;"       )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   shiny::observeEvent(input$start_timer, {     shinyTimer::countDown(session, "shiny_timer")   })   shiny::observeEvent(input$timer_done, {     shinyMobile::f7Dialog(       id = "dialog",       title = "Time's Up!",       text = ""     )   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Set shinyTimer in motion — countDown
text: session session object shiny server function. inputId input ID corresponding UI element.

title: shinyTimer widget — shinyTimer
code: shinyTimer(   inputId,   label = NULL,   minutes = 0,   seconds = 0,   format = "simple",   ... )

title: shinyTimer widget — shinyTimer
text: inputId input id. label label display countdown. minutes integer, starting time minutes countdown. seconds integer, starting time seconds countdown. format format countdown timer display (either "simple" "clock"). ... additional parameters want pass placeholder timer (htmltools::tags$div).

title: Update shinyTimer widget — updateShinyTimer
